captions.text: You could sweat at anytime. Really, anytime.
You have to walk somewhere, you're warm.
Upstairs maybe? You're moist. You have to carry something too? You're f****** sweating.
Coffee makes you sweat. Iced coffee makes you sweat.
If there's a strap on you, you're gonna sweat a little bit extra right where that strap is.
Sitting in a chair makes your back sweat. You avoid raising your arms because doing so would reveal just how sweaty you are.
You may have googled hyperhidrosis and then wondered just how sweaty does a person need to be in order to have a medical sweating condition
You've perfected the shirt fluff technic to help air yourself out even though it does nothing.
You've been asked seriously, 'is it raining out?' and jokingly, 'hey is it raining out?' Fuck that second person.
Sometimes you'll wear layers to hide how sweaty you are but that just makes you warmer and sweatier and eventually you have to take off that layer.
and reveal that you're now the sweatiest you've ever been. And thinking about how sweaty you are makes you nervous about how sweaty you are which just makes you sweat even more
*huff* But it's fine because, every body sweats, just some people are a little better at it than others.

title: Problems Only Sweaty People Will Understand

comments.author: alisha soares

comments.text:
i live in a tropical country. with super sunny weather plus high humidity, 
multiply all of those by like a hundred. i try really hard to maintain good 
hygiene (thank god i don't smell) but when i sweat all over my face, i look 
so haggard and unpresentable. :( it's so embarrassing and it's holding me 
back in so many ways. if i don't sweat too much, i would be more sociable 
and participate in extra-curricular activities. i hate going to parties. I 
hate summer so much. Anything that requires both socializing and warm 
environment is my worst nightmare and i avoid it at all cost. people think 
i'm snobbish but it's just that when i feel like if i move an inch i would 
sweat, i would just pretend i'm uninterested in whatever's going on around 
me. i'm always so conscious about how much i'm sweating which makes me 
sweat more. it's fucking depressing tbh.﻿
